Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for monday, january 19th.

amazon is stepping up its focus on drone delivery, announcing a plan to expand its prime air service to new cities later this year. the company is currently testing the service in california and texas, aiming to make delivery times even shorter for customers. this move comes as amazon faces increasing competition from other retail giants investing in swift delivery solutions.

meta platforms is reportedly working on a new augmented reality headset, aiming to make a significant leap in the ar space. the tech company is hoping to debut its new device at the annual meta connect conference later this year. meta's ceo, mark zuckerberg, has been vocal about his ambitions to lead the charge in the virtual and augmented reality markets, seeing it as a critical frontier for tech innovation.

alphabet's waymo is seeing strong momentum as they expand their autonomous taxi services. recent reports show that waymo has doubled its fleet in phoenix, and now plans to bring its technology to more u.s. cities. this expansion comes after successful trials and a growing acceptance of autonomous transport options among consumers.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for monday, january 19th.

amazon is amplifying its drone delivery efforts, with plans to expand its prime air service to new cities later this year. the service is currently being tested in california and texas, with the goal of further shortening delivery times for customers. this initiative comes as amazon faces mounting competition from other retail giants who are also investing in rapid delivery solutions.

meta platforms is reportedly developing a new augmented reality headset, aiming for a substantial leap in the ar arena. the tech giant hopes to unveil the device at the annual meta connect conference later this year. meta's ceo, mark zuckerberg, has been outspoken about his ambition to lead the virtual and augmented reality markets, viewing it as a vital frontier for tech innovation.

alphabet's waymo is gaining significant traction as it expands its autonomous taxi services. recent reports indicate that waymo has doubled its fleet in phoenix and plans to extend its technology to more u.s. cities. this expansion follows successful trials and increasing consumer acceptance of autonomous transportation options.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-456 Amazon's Drone Delivery Expansion 🚁, Meta's Ar Headset Ambitions 🕶️, Waymo's Autonomous Taxi Growth 🚖
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for monday, january 19th! explore today's tech updates:

  • amazon's drone delivery expansion: plans to broaden prime air service to more cities later this year, currently testing in california and texas, aiming to speed up delivery times amid rising competition.
  • meta's new ar headset: development underway for a major step forward in augmented reality, with a reveal anticipated at the upcoming meta connect conference, marking a strategic push by ceo mark zuckerberg.
  • waymo's autonomous taxi growth: waymo doubles its fleet in phoenix, expanding its autonomous taxi services to additional u.s. cities following successful trials and growing consumer acceptance.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image set in a futuristic cityscape at dusk. in the foreground, a sleek, cutting-edge drone hovers gracefully over a bustling urban environment, symbolizing amazon's drone delivery service. its rotors cast subtle reflections on nearby skyscrapers, adding dynamism to the scene. to the right, an individual wearing an advanced augmented reality headset peers into the distance, with digital overlays and holograms subtly interacting with the real-world environment, capturing meta's ar ambitions. below, an autonomous taxi from waymo glides smoothly along a smart road, seamlessly integrated into the traffic flow. the vehicle's sensors emit a soft, luminescent glow, indicating its navigational prowess. the image harmonizes these elements, highlighting the convergence of technology—drones, ar, and autonomous vehicles—in crafting an innovative urban future
